body.p: Changes the definition of a tablespace.

section.title: Synopsis
section.codeblock:
ALTER TABLESPACE name RENAME TO newname
ALTER TABLESPACE name OWNER TO newowner

section.title: Description
section.p: ALTER TABLESPACE changes the definition of a tablespace.

You must own the tablespace to use ALTER TABLESPACE. To alter the owner, you must also be a direct or indirect member of the new owning role. (Note that superusers have these privileges automatically.)

plentry.pd: The name of an existing tablespace.
The new name of the tablespace. The new name cannot begin with pg_ or gp_ (reserved for system tablespaces).
The new owner of the tablespace.

section.title: Examples
section.codeblock: ALTER TABLESPACE index_space RENAME TO fast_raid;
section.p: Change the owner of tablespace index_space:
section.codeblock: ALTER TABLESPACE index_space OWNER TO mary;

section.title: Compatibility
section.p: There is no ALTER TABLESPACE statement in the SQL standard.
